frame.name: Rite
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame concerns rituals performed in line with religious beliefs or tradition.
<ex>In certain <fex name="Desired_state_of_affairs">fertility</fex> <t>rites</t> <fex name="Place">in Burma</fex> , a woman desirous of offspring is required not only to approach the King Cobra but to plant a kiss on its mouth .</ex>
<ex><fex name="Member">He</fex> was <t>ordered</t> <fex name="New_status">a priest</fex> <fex name="Time">in 1944</fex>. <fex name="Leader">CNI</fex> </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Leader
FE.definition:
<def-root>This is the religious or cultural leader who performs and/or leads the rite.
<ex><fex name="Ldr">The medicine man</fex> performs this <t>ritual</t></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Member
FE.definition:
<def-root>The FE <fen>Member</fen> describes the member of the religious or cultural group who participates in/undergoes the rite.
<ex><fex name="Mbr">Joe</fex> received <t>communion</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Organization
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Organization</fen> identifies the institution in which the rite is prescribed.
<ex>His <t>baptism</t> <fex name="Org">into the Catholic Church</fex> is scheduled for next Sunday.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>The action that is taken to perform the ritual.
<ex>A building is <t>consecrated</t> <fex name="Mns">by anointing the doorposts with special oil and saying certain prayers</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Instrument</fen> used to perform a particular rite.
<ex>We <t>baptise</t> children <fex name="Instrument">with holy water</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Desired_state_of_affairs
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the state which the rite is hoped or intended to bring about. <ex>They performed a <fex name="DesS">fertility</fex> <t>ritual</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition:
<def-root>The type of ritual or ceremony being performed.
<ex>We performed the traditional <fex name="Type">marriage</fex> <t>rites</t></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Object
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE indicates an object on which a rite is performed.
<ex>The priest <t>blessed</t> <fex name="Obj">the wine</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: New_status
FE.definition:
<def-root>Rites may confer a <fen>New_status</fen> on a participant (e.g. rank, membership).
<ex>Elliott was almost <t>ordained</t> <fex name="NStat">as a priest</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Guardian
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Guardian</fen> is the member of the <fen>Organization</fen> who instigates the rite for someone of which they are a guardian.
<ex><fex name = "Guardian">Mr. and Mrs. Wilson</fex> <t>baptized</t> their son.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: christen.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to baptize as a sign of admission to a Christian church

lexUnit.name: baptism.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the Christian rite of sprinkling water on to a person's forehead or of immersing them in water, symbolizing purification or regeneration and admission to the Christian Church

lexUnit.name: eucharist.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the Christian service, ceremony, or sacrament commemorating the Last Supper, in which bread and wine are consecrated and consumed

lexUnit.name: confirmation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: (in the Christian Church) the rite at which a baptized person affirms Christian belief and is admitted as a full member of the Church

lexUnit.name: pray.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: address a prayer to God or another deity

lexUnit.name: prayer.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a solemn request for help or expression of thanks addressed to God or another deity

lexUnit.name: mass.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the Christian Eucharist or Holy Communion, especially in the Roman Catholic Church.

lexUnit.name: communion.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the service of Christian worship at which bread and wine are consecrated and shared; the Eucharist

lexUnit.name: bless.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: consecrate or invoke divine favour upon (someone) by means of a religious rite

lexUnit.name: blessing.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a prayer asking for God's favour and protection

lexUnit.name: consecrate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make or declare sacred

lexUnit.name: anoint.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: smear or rub with oil, especially as part of a religious ceremony

lexUnit.name: unction.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action of anointing someone with oil or ointment as a religious rite

lexUnit.name: rite.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a religious or other solemn ceremony or act

lexUnit.name: ritual.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a religious or solemn ceremony involving a series of actions performed according to a prescribed order.

lexUnit.name: confirm.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: administer the religious rite of confirmation to

lexUnit.name: circumcise.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cut off the foreskin of (a young boy or man) as a Jewish or Islamic rite or cut off the clitoris, and sometimes the labia, of (a girl or young woman) as a traditional practice in some cultures

lexUnit.name: circumcision.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action or practice of circumcising

lexUnit.name: service.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a ceremony of religious worship according to a prescribed form

lexUnit.name: ordination.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action of ordaining someone in holy orders

lexUnit.name: vigil.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: (in the Christian Church) the eve of a festival or holy day as an occasion of religious observance. [Eccl]

lexUnit.name: confession.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a formal admission of one's sins privately to a priest.

lexUnit.name: baptize.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: administer baptism to

lexUnit.name: sacrament.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: (in the Christian Church) a religious ceremony or ritual regarded as imparting divine grace, such as baptism, the Eucharist, and (in the Catholic and many Orthodox Churches) penance and the anointing of the sick.

lexUnit.name: ordain.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: confer holy orders on.

lexUnit.name: christening.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the ritual of giving a name at baptism in a Christian Church

lexUnit.name: consecration.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the performing of a ritual which makes or declares an object to be sacred; ordination to a sacred office

lexUnit.name: bar mitzvah.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the religious initiation ceremony of a Jewish boy who has reached the age of 13

lexUnit.name: sacrifice.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the practice or an act of killing an animal or person or surrendering a possession as an offering to a deity.

lexUnit.name: initiation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: formal admission into a group, usually by means a ritual

lexUnit.name: initiate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: admit formally into a society or group, typically with a ritual.

lexUnit.name: rite of passage.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a ceremony or event, e.g. marriage, marking an important stage in someone's life

lexUnit.name: evensong.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: (especially in the Anglican Church) a service of evening prayers, psalms, and canticles

lexUnit.name: worship.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: religious rites and ceremonies.

lexUnit.name: vesper.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: evening prayer.

lexUnit.name: sacrifice.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: offer or give up as a sacrifice.

lexUnit.name: order.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to ordain (passive only - archaic)

lexUnit.name: exercise.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a ceremony or procession
